summary: "Inside Out" is a 2015 Pixar movie about a girl named Riley and the five emotions inside her head: Joy, Sadness, Fear, Anger, and Disgust. They help her deal with her family's move to a new city. Director Pete Docter got the idea from watching his daughter grow up. The movie took five years to make and cost $175 million. It was a big hit, making $858.8 million worldwide and winning an Oscar for Best Animated Feature. A sequel came out in 2024.
title: Inside Out (2015 film)
